chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Freeman Lamont Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes:
STAYED
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Ct 2 of this case
.

STAYED - with Conditions the same as Probation that is imposed
.

The Court provides that it is in the best interest of the def, general public, and the victim to have case transfer to State of TN - DOC to work zealously to transfer the conditions to TN ASAP.  The Court would not object to financial obligations being converted to a Civil Judgment so as not to stand in the way of a transfer to TN
.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Domesitc Violence assessment and comply with any treatment recommended

Participate in Domestic Court Reviews

Pay $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge (see 'other' above)

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
